channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Entire carriageway flooded, 8th October
item.description:
Both lanes of Ermin Way are flooded due to overflowing drain logged on 27-September on reference 6525362. Rainfall is causing danger to motorists and pedestrians unable to use footpaths.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drains in the road canâ€™t cope with the rain and are backing up causing water to come out of the rain water drain in our property, 8th October
item.description:
The water is coming out of the drain in our property. Pixwold, Gloucester Road, GL54 4HR. This is causing our garden to fill with water and threaten our buildings with flooding. The water is coming from the drains in the road and as this is a mixed system this also potentially contains sewerage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain blocked, street flooded, 8th October
item.description:
Drain blocked, street fully flooded
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Welveland Lane, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drains, 8th October
item.description:
Drains overwhelmed by rain outside # 31, 33, 29 houses also opposite side of road drains. Leading to water up driveways exacabted by thoughtless speeding drivers ..... Suggest drains need to be pressure washed to clear. Grave risk of needless flooding of properties if nothing done to remedy !

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lavington Drive, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding of turning circle, 8th October
item.description:
We believe the drain that leads off the turning circle is not adequate - there is no grill to prevent debris going down it and as such our turning circle floods almost every time it rains. During the rains of 23/09 the water levels were high enough to breach the pavement and come up our drive (283 Priors Road). I have a video to demonstrate but cannot add this here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 285, Priors Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mack house has blocked alleyway with a fence and a bollard and removed resident's bins council aware will replace bins once highways has reinstated alleyway and removed bollard., 8th October
item.description:
Alleyway at 15a bath road Cheltenham Gloucestershire gl537hg
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13b, Bath Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drains blocked on land and insufficient drains to cope with intense rainfall bringing top soil off fields, 8th October
item.description:
Bitumen Field House, Riverside House, Oakwood House and one other are all dependent on good road drainage along the lane at Colesbourne GL53 9NS. These drains are constantly being filled with silt from the fields above the lane. With the change in the amount and intensity of rainfall it is only a matter of time before these houses are flooded.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colesbourne, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: As reported last week. When it rains there is a flood. The path has sunk and we cannot access our house., 8th October
item.description:
Outside 82 Evesham Road Perhaps the next time you send someone it should be when it is raining!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Drive, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Puddle from drainage, 8th October
item.description:
There is a puddle that happens every time there is heavy rain, you can't see the drop down curb because of the standing water.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Sun Street, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham

item.title: Bollard and road sign hit by a car 2 weeks ago., 8th October
item.description:
The bollard and road signs have police tape after car hit them at the crossroads on the brow of the hill which is a busy junction leading to Cleeve Golf club at the crossroads of Cleeve Hill and Langley Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wickfield Lane, Tewkesbury

item.category: Bollard cover is off but not causing a trip hazard/obstruction

item.title: Blocked drains allowing run off water from farm and rd to run over the cirencester rd and then blocking drainage outside woodligh Cirencester rd with soil and straw, 8th October
item.description:
Drains blocked on the junction of the lane to roman villa and cirencester rd little witcombe drains have been blocked for more than 6 months causing flooding

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Flooding in Moselle drive, 8th October
item.description:
Same issue. Heavy rainfall, drain couldnâ€™t cope after 10 minutes then after another 15 minutes road was completely flooded. This needs to be addressed immediately please

item.title: A telecommunications cabinet was damaged and leaning several months ago. After a couple of weeks red plastic barriers were placed round it but it has remained untouched since., 8th October

item.title: Drain blocked, 8th October
item.description:
The drain was unblocked a few weeks ago. The road flooded again today, although it did slowly go down. The team that came out said the pipe from the road to the horsebere brook has roots in it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colwell Avenue, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Possible subsidence - not really potholes, 8th October
item.description:
As you drive north on Copt Elm Road from Lyefield Road there are three large dips in the surface. They have all been repaired at least once, but are still worsening. Please confirm they will be fully investigated before you resurface the road in November. We wouldn't want a bus to fall into a sink hole!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61, Copt Elm Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
